com.ibm.db2.r2dbc

Class DB2ConnectionFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.db2.r2dbc.DB2ConnectionFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    io.r2dbc.spi.ConnectionFactory

    public class DB2ConnectionFactory
extends Object
implements io.r2dbc.spi.ConnectionFactory
    A factory object that can create DB2Connection objects.

      • init

        public reactor.core.publisher.Mono<Void> init(DB2Connection c)
        User can override this method to do initialization tasks on the connection just created. Typical tasks include setting current schema etc., and preparing the PreparedStatements upfront and keeping them ready for frequent executions later in the lifetime of the connection.

        Example: 

          
    // Define the SQLs whose prepared statements you want to cache
    public static class SQL {
        // All SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE and DELETE statements can be cached
        // Following statements assume existance of ACCBAL table with ID and BALANCE columns.
        public static final String ADD = "INSERT INTO ACCBAL (ID, BALANCE) VALUES (?, ?)";
        public static final String REMOVE = "DELETE FROM ACCBAL WHERE ID = ?";
        public static final String CREDIT = "UPDATE ACCBAL SET BALANCE = BALANCE + ? WHERE ID = ?";
        public static final String DEBIT = "UPDATE ACCBAL SET BALANCE = BALANCE - ? WHERE ID = ?";

        // SET statements will not be cached. They can be invoked once when a new connection is created.
        public static final String SET_SCHEMA = "SET CURRENT SCHEMA TS1234";
    }

    // Define a custom connection factory
    public static class MyConnectionFactory extends DB2ConnectionFactory {
        // Constructor
        public MyConnectionFactory(DB2ConnectionConfiguration configuration) {
            super(configuration);
        }

        // Override the init method, this method will be called once for each new connection instance
        public Mono<Void> init(DB2Connection con) {
            // perform all the initialization tasks to be done for the connection
            return Mono.just(con)
                       .delayUntil(c -> c.executeUpdate(SQL.SET_SCHEMA))
                       .delayUntil(c -> c.createStatement(SQL.ADD).prepare())
                       .delayUntil(c -> c.createStatement(SQL.REMOVE).prepare())
                       .delayUntil(c -> c.createStatement(SQL.CREDIT).prepare())
                       .delayUntil(c -> c.createStatement(SQL.DEBIT).prepare())
                       .then();
        }
    }

    // Use the custom factory to create a connection pool
    DB2ConnectionConfiguration config = DB2ConnectionConfiguration.builder()
                                            .database(_database)
                                            .host(_host)
                                            .port(_port)
                                            .username(_userid)
                                            .password(_password)
                                            .conPoolSize(25)   // max connections
                                            .stmtCacheSize(10) // max statements to cache
                                            .build();

    MyConnectionFactory factory = new MyConnectionFactory(config);
    DB2ConnectionPool cp = new DB2ConnectionPool(factory);

    // Get a pooled connection. This connection will have the prepared statement cache initialized
    Mono<DB2Connection> con = cp.getConnection();
        Parameters:
        c - Connection to be initialized
        Returns:
        Mono<Void> indicates completion status
